doc.name: currentTime

syntax.example: set the currentTime of player to number

doc.summary: Specifies the elapsed time in a movie or sound.

examples.example: set the currentTime of player "Open Door" to 300

description.p: Use the currentTime property during playing to find out the progress of the movie or sound, or to skip ahead or back.
The currentTime of a player is an integer between zero and the player's duration.
The currentTime is the number of the interval where the current position is.
The number of intervals per second is specified by the player's timeScale property. The total number of intervals is given in the player's duration property.
